virtual ~RegBlobObject ()
 Destructor of the object. The data pointed to is deleted.

Detailed Description

RegBlobObject contains a pointer to allocated data, mimetype of the data and the length of this data. It can be used to export data from a provider where data inside the provider is changed during the usage of the RegBlobObject object. All data is copied during construction time and deleted during destruction time.

INT RegBlobObject::Peek (  INT  offset,
UINT8 *&  data,
INT  length
) 
 

Reads data with given length out from the RegBlobObject (starting with offset). If length == -1, then the maximum possible data (from offset to end of data) is returned. Returns the number of read bytes.

Reimplemented from BlobObject.

INT RegBlobObject::Poke (  INT  offset,
const UINT8 *  data,
INT  length
) 
 

Writes data into the RegBlobObject (starting with offset). Data will be truncated, if there is no more space to store in RegBlobObject. Returns the number of written bytes.

Reimplemented from BlobObject.
